item.title: Obama criticises virus response in speech
item.description: Former US President Barack Obama has criticised some officials overseeing the coronavirus response, telling college graduates in an online address that the pandemic shows many officials "aren't even pretending to be in charge".

item.title: Italy looks to reopen borders next month
item.description: Italy will open its borders to travellers from Europe from next month to unwind one of the world's most rigid coronavirus lockdowns.

item.title: UK arrests 19 at anti-lockdown protest
item.description: London police have arrested 19 people for deliberately breaking social distancing guidelines in protest against the rules, on the first weekend since Prime Minister Boris Johnson announced a slight loosening of England's lockdown.

item.title: US politicians eye inspector general probe
item.description: US lawmakers say that they have opened a probe into President Donald Trump's firing of the State Department's head of internal audits, inspector general Steve Linick.

item.title: Shops, eateries await easing regulations
item.description: Officials have cautiously eased restrictions on eateries, shops and outdoor venues in some countries as they try to restart economies without triggering a surge in new coronavirus infections.

item.title: India overtakes China in virus cases
item.description: India's confirmed coronavirus cases have surpassed China's, with the health ministry reporting a spike to 85,940 infections and 2752 deaths.

item.title: Libertarian Amash ends US presidency bid
item.description: US congressman Justin Amash, a former Republican who quit the party to become an independent, has announced he will not seek the Libertarian nomination for the White House only weeks after saying he was running because voters wanted an "alternative" to the two major parties.

item.title: French virus death toll rises to 27,625
item.description: French health authorities have reported 96 new coronavirus deaths as the country eases from a two month lockdown.

item.title: Puerto Ricans to vote on US statehood
item.description: Governor Wanda Vazquez says she will hold a non-binding referendum in November to decide whether Puerto Rico should become a US state.

item.title: Pregnant woman dead, three hurt in crash
item.description: A young pregnant woman and her baby have been killed, and her boyfriend and two others seriously injured, in a horrific head-on crash in Perth.
